text: Dumb but big, mean and tough enough to make other monsters around him do...something. Sometimes even what he wants them to do.
Troll Boss
A Troll Horde always hungers and the first to battle are the first to feed.
Fed by War
Too Stupid to Care
Trolls have a tendency to be too stupid to notice the fact that they should be afraid of a superior enemy. Sadly they also have a tendency to devour or break important supplies.
Devour them all!
In anticipation of a great feast, the trolls and monsters run faster and even shake off the toothpicks and pebbles that are launched to slow them down!
Born for bloody fights, skinwolves become a whirlwind of claws and teeth on the battlefield.
Bloodlust
Hit Harder
Hitting as hard as possible without getting tired fast is the pinnacle of Troll fighting techniques!
This Troll and his horde eat their enemies. And wounded comrades. Well actually they eat about everything.
Motivated by Hunger but Insatiable
Stronger than most others of his kind, but easy to enrage.
Mighty but Choleric
Destructive
Hates every kind of structure and will destroy them. Yours as well as the enemies.
Obidient but Stupid as a Rock
Does everything what Throgg commands him to do. But whenever something unexpected happens, it all falls apart.
Intimidating but all Show
Makes a lot of noise, looks scary, but actually as brave as the average skaven.
Completly Broken
Throgg took control of this one so often that what little mind the troll had is completly gone. Even the dumbest troll notices that something is not right with this one.
Strong Willed
It is not easy to force this Troll to do anything. Everytime Throgg is not checking on him, he goes off to do whatever comes to his mind.
All You Can Eat: Skaven
Easy to scare, numerous and really everywhere. As long as one doesn't get tired of swinging their club around, no troll needs to go hungry!
The classics never get old. For preperation they just need to be squished well and voila, another troll meal ready.
Home Cooking: Humans
They need to be peeled out of their hard shell before consumption but have a unique intense taste.
Crustaceans: Dwarfs
Having tasted one of those, most trolls immideatly want another. They just need to endure being showered with pointy sticks.
Haute Cuisine: Elves
Dry Aged Meat: Undead
Some trolls enjoy the soft texture of aged meat and sucking out the marrow of the bones. They just need to be brave enough to approach the living dead.
They often come running towards trolls, yelling and waving their sharp metal, so they are easy to collect. They also come in a smaller snack sized variant for the smaller hunger.
Junk Food: Greenskins
Gamey Food: Beastmen
Combining the taste of wild animal and humans, some trolls are hooked on beastmen meat. They just need to be fast enough to catch them and match their wildness to best them.
Exotic Food: Lizardmen

It is not often that the trolls of the old world get to enjoy the meat of giant lizards. But the really big ones can feed a whole group of trolls when brought down and if you hit extra hard, then the scales are no problem at all either.

True Troll gourmets swear on the taste of chaos corrupted meat. It has a nice burning aftertaste like no other. They just need to make sure not to become the meal of the chaos creature themselves and match their savagery in combat.
Spicey Food: Chaos
Intelligence is not a requirement to earn Khornes favor.
Touched by Khorne
Grandfather Nurgle generously spreads his gifts throughout the mortal world, even to such unworthy beings as Trolls.
Touched by Nurgle
Even a Troll can catch the eye of the Prince of Excess - mostly because of their indulgance into gluttony.
Touched by Slaneesh
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some Frost Troll in him, enabling him to channel the frost of their Norscan home.
Frost Troll Blood
River Troll Blood
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some River Troll in him, enabling him to spew poison like his brethren.
Stone Troll Blood
Either by lineage or by mutation, this Troll has some Stone Troll in him, giving him the resilience of their kind.
The might of the untamed beast of the Norscan Wilds is unrivaled and few can withstand it.
Feral Masters

Throgg can take direct control over his subjects, using them as puppets and breaking their will so far that they will never flee from battle. But even the dumbest monster will instinctively feel that their leader is obviously lacking leadership when Throgg doesn't possess them.
Mind Controlled
Leader of Trolls
Throgg is the only troll in existance really qualified to lead an army, especially if it is an army of his brethren.
Bringer of Destruction
Throgg's ultimate goal is the destruction of all and any civilization. He has not much love for what it offers and will only begrudgingly use whatever the Norse towns offer to further his cause.
Troll Strategist
Throgg repeatedly outmaneuvers the best generals in the world, especially when they underestimate him.
Man Eater
Battle time is feeding time!
Battlehardened Kin
Even a troll will somehow improve if they survive enough battles. Fighting under Throgg's leadership makes this even suprisingly likely.
Different from all other trolls, Throgg knows what is valueable and worth keeping and what is junk.
Knowledgable Looter
The time of humans comes to an end. They have served their purpose as monsters flock Throgg's army. Only the dumb and greedy among humans will stay and fight for him.
Lord of the Monster Horde
Instead of leading his forces properly, the Troll roars at the enemy, swings his weight around and does his best to frighten the opponent.
Intimidating
March of Eternal Winter
Where Throgg goes, the land is warped by the power of Chaos - something that Throgg enjoys. And so he pushes his Horde ever onwards into foreign lands, to further the coming of his ice age.
Grabs and keeps whatever arouses his interest. Sadly, he has absolutly no sense for value. However, what the loot lacks in quality it makes up for in quantity.
Mindless Hoarder
Dumb Luck
Strolls right into cannonfire, is clumsy in combat and makes all the wrong choices. Still gets more often away with it than he has any right to.
Inhumane Stength
What trolls lack in elegance and grace they make up for in ferocity and pure strength.
Troll Boss
Big, mean and tough enough to make other monsters around him do...something. Sometimes even what he wants them to do.

These Trolls have braved the stormy cold planes, wastelands and hostile mountains of the North day for day. Those who survive long enough will be even more difficult opponents than their less hardened kin.
Scourge of the North
Always Hungry
Hunger is a the most effective way to make trolls take part in battles. The hungrier the troll, the more fighting he is willing to do.
Horrors of the Mountains
The Mountains are home not only to the steadfast Dawi, but also to the horrors that hunt them.
Blight of Men
The lands of weak mankind are teeming with Trolls, many of which are tougher, meaner and hungrier than the average troll. These trolls make fine recruits for Throggs army.
Children of Chaos
Trolls are creatures of chaos. They themselves may have forgotten about it, but they retained many of the twisted gifts the forces of chaos provide to their followers.
Unnatural Resilience
Flesh healing faster than weapons can wound it and skin thicker than most armour.
Deadly Menace
Trolls are everywhere in the old world and some of the more foolish inhabitants of these lands see them rather as a nuisance than a true danger.
Creatures of Ice and Snow
These Trolls seem to carry the very might of frost and ice within their veins.
Cyclopean Champions
The most feared and savage creatures of chaos march alongside Throgg to bring ruin over the Forces of Order.
King of Trolls
Throgg leads ever growing hordes of his kin against the weak forces of the South.
Troll Flesh
Trolls heal incredibly fast, allowing them to recover from almost any wound in no time.
Troll Toll
Only beta trolls hide under bridges!
River Troll Chieftain
Considering that Chief Ugma is a River Troll himself, it might not be too suprising that he is especially experienced in leading others of his kind.
Eloquent Troll
Chief Ugma loves to mock his enemies in their own language. It is suprisingly disturbing to hear a supposedly dumb Troll taunt in perfect Reikspiel.
Burning Hatred
Many trolls hate the Dwarfs and side with the Greenskins out of convinience. Ugma hates both sides of the conflict equally.
Warpstone-touched
Intelligence is not the only change the contact with warpstone caused in Chief Ugma. It also made him much tougher than the average troll.
The Strongest River Troll
No other River Troll can compare to Ugma. He is the toughest, meanest and strongest River Troll around. Even his stench is worse!
Ugma's Trash Armour
Ugma improvised his armour himself. It is made from the equipment of foes he bested. Some of the items have magical effects which additionally benefit him.
Karak Azgal Stone Hammer

Chief Ugma's oversized hammer has probably been taken from the statue of a Dwarf hero or ancestor god in the fallen Karak Azgal. Chief Umga doesn't seem to care though, all that matters is that the hammer has the right size and doesn't break.
River Troll Chieftain of Karak Azgal
Ugma started as a leader of a small tribe of River Troll and Cavern Trolls in a fallen Karak, fighting and plundering adventurers who dared to brave the depths of this dangerous forsaken Dwarf hold.
Me Boss Now!
In the long run a troll champion cannot hold a horde together, but in the midst of battle his presence is enough to keep the trolls in line.
Corrosive Vomit
Not as impressive - or repulsive - as a Troll lord, but still deadly enough.
Violent Command
Maybe his intelligence is not too impressive, but violence alone can be enough to keep the weaker trolls in line.
Dirty
A troll's hygiene is never impressive, but this disgusting creature reeks so badly that a constant swarm of flies is buzzing around it at all times.
Angry
Most troll's are easy to anger, but this one is more vicious than others.
Resilient
Not only are its wounds healing rapidily, on top of that it is difficult to actually injure this troll.
Runner
Trolls look slow and lumbering, but can be surprisingly fast. This one is faster than most though.
